about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: This road sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This road sign means: | This road sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are arriving upon a fork in the road and they must bear either right or left.

comment.text: The roadway ends ahead.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drivers must bear either right or left.

comment.text: Drivers must bear either right or left.
A four-way intersection is ahead.

acceptedAnswer.text: Drivers must bear either right or left.

comment.text: Drivers must bear either right or left.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are arriving upon a fork in the road and they must bear either right or left.

comment.text: This road sign means: | Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are arriving upon a fork in the road and they must bear either right or left.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: This road sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: Which of these is a safe driving technique?

about.name: Which of these is a safe driving technique?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these is a safe driving technique? | Which of these is a safe driving technique? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

suggestedAnswer.text: Using your high beam lights in the fog.

comment.text: Using your high beam lights in the fog.

suggestedAnswer.text: Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.

comment.text: Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.
Checking your rearview mirrors frequently.
Checking your rearview mirrors frequently.

answerExplanation.text: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

comment.text: Which of these is a safe driving technique? | To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

hasPart.name: Large trucks are likely to lose speed when:

about.name: Large trucks are likely to lose speed when:

hasPart.assesses: Large trucks are likely to lose speed when: | Large trucks are likely to lose speed when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Because large trucks require more time to accelerate than smaller vehicles, trucks can lose speed driving up long or steep hills. Be cautious when driving behind a large truck and be sure to give the vehicle additional space, especially when driving on an incline.

suggestedAnswer.text: Driving up long or steep hills.

comment.text: Driving up long or steep hills.
Driving in long, gradual curves.
Driving down long, gradual hills.

acceptedAnswer.text: Driving up long or steep hills.

comment.text: Driving up long or steep hills.

answerExplanation.text: Because large trucks require more time to accelerate than smaller vehicles, trucks can lose speed driving up long or steep hills. Be cautious when driving behind a large truck and be sure to give the vehicle additional space, especially when driving on an incline.

comment.text: Large trucks are likely to lose speed when: | Because large trucks require more time to accelerate than smaller vehicles, trucks can lose speed driving up long or steep hills. Be cautious when driving behind a large truck and be sure to give the vehicle additional space, especially when driving on an incline.

hasPart.name: The speed limit in any alley is:

about.name: The speed limit in any alley is:

hasPart.assesses: The speed limit in any alley is: | The speed limit in any alley is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: The speed limit in any alley is 15 mph. This is always the speed limit, whether or not it is posted.

comment.text: 20 mph.
15 mph.
25 mph.
15 mph.

answerExplanation.text: The speed limit in any alley is 15 mph. This is always the speed limit, whether or not it is posted.

comment.text: The speed limit in any alley is: | The speed limit in any alley is 15 mph. This is always the speed limit, whether or not it is posted.

hasPart.name: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead to load or unload children, you must:

about.name: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead to load or unload children, you must:

hasPart.assesses: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead to load or unload children, you must: | When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead to load or unload children, you must: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead with its lights flashing and its stop arm extended, you must come to a complete stop and wait to proceed until the lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn. Even after the bus begins to move again, do not proceed until you are sure there are no children crossing the road ahead of you.

suggestedAnswer.text: Come to a complete stop until all the children have left the bus.

comment.text: Come to a complete stop until all the children have left the bus.

suggestedAnswer.text: Come to a complete stop until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn.

comment.text: Come to a complete stop until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn.

suggestedAnswer.text: Change lanes, drive slowly, and pass the bus cautiously.

comment.text: Change lanes, drive slowly, and pass the bus cautiously.

acceptedAnswer.text: Come to a complete stop until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn.

comment.text: Come to a complete stop until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn.

answerExplanation.text: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead with its lights flashing and its stop arm extended, you must come to a complete stop and wait to proceed until the lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn. Even after the bus begins to move again, do not proceed until you are sure there are no children crossing the road ahead of you.

comment.text: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead to load or unload children, you must: | When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead with its lights flashing and its stop arm extended, you must come to a complete stop and wait to proceed until the lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn. hasPart.name: Abandoning an animal on the highway may result in:

about.name: Abandoning an animal on the highway may result in:

hasPart.assesses: Abandoning an animal on the highway may result in: | Abandoning an animal on the highway may result in: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is illegal to dump or abandon an animal on the highway. Doing so can result in six months of jail time, a fine of up to $1,000, or both.

comment.text: Jail time.
A point against your license.
No legal consequences.
Jail time.

answerExplanation.text: It is illegal to dump or abandon an animal on the highway. Doing so can result in six months of jail time, a fine of up to $1,000, or both.

comment.text: Abandoning an animal on the highway may result in: | It is illegal to dump or abandon an animal on the highway. Doing so can result in six months of jail time, a fine of up to $1,000, or both.
